title: Gas Flares in Bahía de Campeche
description: In the early 1970s, oil exploration turned up vast reservoirs of oil and gas under the Bahía de Campeche, located along the southern margin of the Gulf of Mexico, just west of Mexico’s Yucatán Peninsula. Offshore oil drilling continues in that region today, and signs of the activity are visible from space.
copyright_details: NASA Earth Observatory images created by Jesse Allen and Robert Simmon.

theme.name: MANKIND
theme.description: Traces of human presence on once virgin lands
